oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letters from Emma and Henry James to Dr. F. W. James and his wife, Hepsey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henry and Emma James were the younger siblings of Francis (Frank) W. James, a doctor in Rutherford, Tennessee. Aged seventeen and nine, Henry and Emma lived in Bluff Springs in Gibson County, Tennessee. Henry writes about the corn and cotton crops, and of hearing from their brother George, a soldier in the war. Emma writes about school and her desire to see her nieces and nephews.
